Mr. & Mrs. Smith, Prime Video series based on the 2005 film of the same name starring Donald Glover and Maya Erskine

Mr. & Mrs. Smith - Season 1 Official Teaser Trailer | Prime Video

Two lonely strangers land a job working for a mysterious spy agency that offers them a glorious life of espionage, wealth, world travels and a dream brownstone in Manhattan. The catch: new identities in an arranged marriage as Mr. & Mrs. John and Jane Smith. Now hitched, John and Jane navigate a high risk mission every week while also facing a new relationship milestone. Their complex cover story becomes even more complicated when they catch real feelings for each other. What’s riskier, espionage or marriage? Mr. & Mrs. Smith Premieres on Prime Video February 2nd, 2024.

Donald Glover, Phoebe Waller-Bridge Team for ‘Mr. & Mrs. Smith’ Series at Amazon

The 'Atlanta' and 'Fleabag' duo will create and star in the series, based on the 2005 movie of the same name.

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv ... n-4132594/

Donald Glover’s ‘Mr. & Mrs. Smith’ Remake Delayed to 2024

The series starring Glover and Maya Erskine reimagines the 2005 Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie film.

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv ... 235590808/

Amazon’s ‘Mr. and Mrs. Smith’ Lines Up A-List Guest Cast

Alexander Skarsgard, Eiza Gonzalez, Sarah Paulson and Sharon Horgan are among the actors joining stars Donald Glover and Maya Erskine.

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv ... 235714581/

Brad Pitt was married to Jennifer Aniston at the time of filming. So I compare the soap opera drama and infidelity to that of Ewan MacGregor and Mary Elizabeth Winstead while shooting the TV series "Fargo". These 2 actors probably took a page from Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt's template during this project. LOL

TheHans

Deal Fanatic

5095 posts

4817 upvotes

B.C.

MrMom wrote: ↑ Has anyone watched this? I'm watching E1 right now.

Update: Stick with it.

I'm hoping you're right. We watched half of episode one and stopped. I went to IMDb to perhaps get encouragement LOL and I looked at reviews and saw that generally, those who disliked it, expected it to be like the film and those who liked it didn't expect that. I thought about how when we first watched "Atlanta," we turned it off because we didn't get it. And with Glover and his bro involved and Glover's fav director directing the first two episodes, maybe we didn't get this either. We finished the episode looking at it less as an action show and more like a quirky relationship thing and liked it much more.

Last edited by TheHans on Feb 3rd, 2024 5:55 pm, edited 2 times in total.

If I had more time, I would have written a shorter post

@TheHans i was dying during the first 3/4 of E1. I'm glad I hung around for the surprise. I haven't watched more, but I'm hoping it picks up from here.

@scoper Phoebe Waller-Bridge's Fleabag was different too.

Update

Maybe I have to learn to appreciate the quirky relationship, but as far as they are some type of field agent, they suck. Who talks about all the cities they have been in front of their kidnap victim?

TheHans

Deal Fanatic

5095 posts

4817 upvotes

B.C.

No kidding. I get where you're coming from completely. I did like the first few minutes though and the last 15. And the cat.

Is Glover more buff than he was on "Atlanta"? I think so and evidently judging from the episode he wants people to notice LOL.

EDIT: We watched the whole thing. I felt it was very uneven. We really enjoyed episodes 2-5. A lot. But episodes 6 and 7 didn't work well for me, particularly the one-level interactions between Glover and Erskine, despite some great work from Sarah Paulson and Michaela Cole in those episodes. The finale was strong, but I thought a bit too drawn out. Hard to say more without spoilers, but I'm interested to hear what others thought.

If I had more time, I would have written a shorter post

MrMom wrote: ↑ Just finished. For good. Can't recommend it. "Uneven" is generous. I liked the neighbours explanation for his "spying." I like the other Smiths. What a disappointment.

I felt it was interesting, but it definitely fizzled. I'm pretty sure I was multitasking for the last few.

The show definitely seemed to tinker with viewer expectations.

I was very much expecting Sarah Paulson to be a target/mission, who they also decided to milk for input before killing her.

I'm curious - is there a plan for s2?

Maybe the concept they have in mind is to keep mixing around?

So s2 would be somewhere different, with new people.

Perhaps a later encounter with anyone who survived the finale?

Otherwise, is it ByBy?

B.C.

MrMom wrote: ↑ Just finished. For good. Can't recommend it. "Uneven" is generous. I liked the neighbours explanation for his "spying." I like the other Smiths. What a disappointment.

So true that it had lots of disappointment and I suppose I was generous, but that scene you mentioned with the neighbour in the last episode was great! When Paul Dano first appeared in episode 2, I wondered what he was actually doing there because he didn't have much to do in the show at all. But that sequence with Glover in the last episode explained it IMO. Who gets bullied more convincingly than Paul Dano? It was no "I drink your milkshake," but Glover's no Daniel Day-Lewis either. It was a highlight of the finale for sure.
